channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for UT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for UT

item.title: Report X-2024020953
item.description:
Report X-2024020953

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: MAGNA
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Possible disregard for the orientation arrows. DescribePack: Loose Caps on one of the bottles caused the liquid to escape. The package was placed in a plastic lined Hazmat container and placed on the vent table and the vent was turned on. DurationRel: 7 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic lined Hazmat container and placed on the vent table and the vent was turned on.

item.title: Report E-2024020459
item.description:
Report E-2024020459

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: W VALLEY CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 12, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of ink were damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel containerized the three (3) 5-gallon pails into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then deployed absorbents to the release and collected and containerized the spent absorbents in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.
